ratings.question_text: What is your overall assessment of this course?

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 for a fellow student? Would you recommend AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 to another student? Why or why not?
comments: Pharm 528 gives an overview of cell signaling with details on some of the major pathways and mechanisms. The class size was really small, which facilitated group studying. I might recommend this course with the warning that the exams are long and require a lot of studying.
I would recommend Pharm528 to other students, as it was a very informative and interesting introduction to many different topics having to do with signal transduction.

narratives.question_text: How did this course deepen your knowledge of your discipline/profession? To what extent did this course contribute to your dissertation/research?
comments: Being aware of the different signaling mechanisms and pathways is useful since they play a role in a number of processes. My thesis work is related to signaling, so it was helpful in that respect, but we never directly discussed what I work on.
This course gave me a more thorough understanding of much of the research in my discipline; both in terms of what is currently known as well as experimental approaches used to study these topics.
